lines.text: Your wife has such a beautiful neck...
[as Hutter is on his way to Knock's real estate office]
Not so hasty, young friend! No one can escape his destiny.
You have hurt yourself... your precious blood!
Why did you kill them... the lovely flowers...?
[And when he crossed the bridge, the phantoms came to meet him]

Nosferatu. Does this word not sound like the midnight call of the Bird of Death? Do not utter it, or the images of life will fade - into pale shadows and ghostly dreams will rise from your heart and feed your Blood.
Go quickly, travel safely, my young friend, to the land of ghosts.
I am going far away to the land of robbers and ghosts.
You must not go further, the werewolf haunts the woods.
I am plagued by mosquitoes. Two have just bitten me on the neck, quite close together, one on each side.
My dreams are heavy in this desolate castle, but do not fear.
Hutter !
Ellen ! Ellen !
I must go to him. He is coming !
Blood is life ! Blood is life !
The Master is near... The Master is near...
Beware that his shadow doth not burden your dreams with horrible fears.
At night, Nosferatu sinketh his fangs into his victim and feedeth on his blood = his hellish elixir of life.
Wherefrom there is no salvation except that a woman without sin should cause the vampire to forget the first cock crow. Of her own free will she should give him her blood.
Bulwer! Fetch Bulwer!
